data.title: Fred Astaire Dance Studios Professionals & Staff
data.meta_description: Foteini Pangea was born in Elassona, Greece growing up in the gym of her parents “Fame”. She moved to Larissa, Greece where, starting at the age of 6,
data.text:
Foteini Pangea was born in Elassona, Greece growing up in the gym of her parents “Fame”. She moved to Larissa, Greece where, starting at the age of 6, she got introduced to a wide range of different dance styles: Ballet, Character, Hip-hop, Oriental, Ballroom, and Latin. As the main member of the undefeated “All Ladies Latin 5 Dance” champions team for 6 years “Bond Girls” gained the experience of the TV show “Greece Got Talent” till the big LIVE finals and every day she loved Ballroom dancing, through competitions and performances more and more not just by being champion & the sport side but also the artistry of it all. Passionate about dance and especially Latin Styles, she started teaching in Larissa, Agia, and Volos from the age of just 16 in many schools and groups & competes with her Youth partner in Greece and representing the country in big tournaments all around Europe. What she loves most about dancing is the amazing impact of the sport in people’s lives and the discovery of the world through dance. That she personally got to experience & travel over 30 different countries and found her dance and life partner through it, Richard Kaszas.

Richard Kaszas started ballroom dancing with his sister at the age of 8 when their mother took them to the dance studio in Debrecen, Hungary. Competing nationally in Ballroom, Latin, and Formation style they decided to join the Romanian “Stephany Dance Club” in Oradea where after 6 months they won the national title & became the champions. They represented that studio nationally and internationally in many European competitions having amazing results in the Youth division. Richard had many tryouts and partners after he and his sister decided to dance with other partners. He found his current partner Foteini Pangea and together they moved, taught, and trained in Romania, Hungary, and Greece, winning national titles & representing the countries in Adult Latin Open Division all around Europe. His strong commitment to sports allowed him, even from a distance, to finish his Bachelor’s Degree in “Sports Management” while practicing 8 hours a day & competing every weekend.

Together in 2016, they made a decision that changed their life, moving to the USA & working for Fred Astaire Dance Studios. Sharing their passion, love, and knowledge and changing people’s lives through dance, while continuing their competitive career by conquering very high titles. With their “champions mindset” in everything they do they became the Top Male & Top Female teachers of the whole franchise for 4 years in a row and going. But they also never stopped dancing competitively and achieving extraordinary results in Latin, Show and now representing American Rhythm in Open Professional Divisions.

Here is a list of some common accomplishments in USA & many more to come:

2017 Triple Crown Champions-New Orleans- Rising Star Pro Latin

2017 Sapphire Dancesport Champions-Austin –Pro Open Latin, 2nd Show Dance

2017 Colorado Star Ball Champions-Denver-Pro Open Latin

2018 Indiana Challenge 2nd place-Michigan City- Pro Open American Rhythm

2018 Southern States Dancesport Champions-New Orleans- Rising Star Pro American Rhythm

2018 Sapphire Dancesport Champions-Austin- Pro Open American Rhythm

2018 Colorado Star Ball Champions-Denver-RS Pro Open American Rhythm Division & Pro Show Dance Division

2018 Millennium Dancesport Championships –New Orleans-1st place RS Pro Open American Rhythm, 2ndplace Open American Rhythm

2018 Fred Astaire Cross Country Dance Championship-Houston- National Champions Pro Closed American Rhythm Division

2018 Sapphire DanceSport Champions-Austin- Pro Open American Rhythm

2019 Indiana Challenge DanceSport –Indiana- 1st place RS Pro Open American Rhythm Division, 2nd place Open American Rhythm Division

2019 St. Louis Star Ball-1st place RS Pro Open American Rhythm, 2nd place Pro Open American Rhythm Division

2020 Vegas Open Champions-Las Vegas-RS Pro Open American Rhythm Division

2021 Twin Cities Open Ballroom Champions-Minneapolis- RS Pro Open American Rhythm Division

2021 Elite Dancesport Champions-Irvine- RS Pro Open American Rhythm Division

2021 Fred Astaire National Champions-Orlando-RS Pro Open American Rhythm

They continue dynamically being on top in their dancing & teaching career & as Texas champions they represent the state & Fred Astaire Dance Studios everywhere they go. They have been multiple years the Top Teachers of the company & now their passion for teaching is expanding & their hope is to train a new generation of dancers & teachers & create a fun elegant environment where all students at any level & age can feel the amazing benefits of ballroom dancing!

They are so passionate about dancing, performing, teaching, and changing people’s lives that their motto is “The world would be a better place if everybody was dancing”.

Regina Kaszas’s journey through the world of ballroom dancing is truly inspiring. From her beginnings in Debrecen, Hungary, competing alongside her brother in various styles, to her rapid rise to success representing the Stephany Dance Club in Romania, Regina has consistently demonstrated her talent and dedication to the art form of dancing. Regina’s biggest achievements are winning the Romanian Championship and being the top 53 in the Youth World Ranking List.

Her decision to prioritize her studies for a period while still excelling in dance speaks to her determination and discipline. Finishing university with two Master Degrees is a remarkable achievement in itself, let alone while managing to continue pursuing her passion for dance and securing numerous titles with a new partner.

The move to Houston, Texas, to join her brother and sister-in-law in sharing their love for dance further illustrates Regina’s commitment to her craft. Teaming up with Joshua and achieving undefeated champion status in Closed and Rising Star Rhythm showcases her exceptional skill and teamwork.

The establishment of the most successful dance studio in Texas is a testament to Regina’s leadership and her ability to inspire others with her enthusiasm for dancing. Her passion for promoting the physical and mental benefits of dance reflects her deep understanding of its transformative power.

Regina’s story serves as a beacon of inspiration for aspiring dancers and demonstrates the profound impact that dedication, perseverance, and a love for the art can have on one’s life and the lives of others.
